channel.title: Which language should I learn?
channel.description: Heyy, I saw the section and I'm tempted to learn a language.. Which one should I learn, I'm kinda tempted to start with java. Is there a certain one to learn where everything else is easier?

item.title: Which language should I learn?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

OP requested lock.

Read full topic

item.title: Which language should I learn?
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

Please do not butt into a conversation that has nothing to do with you and your obscure accusations about me, and please do not try to act like you personally know me Explisionist. And i also ask for you to distance yourself from me, stop making contact with me and leave me alone please.
@Op
Learning a programming language is not an easy thing, mastering it is like trying to learn a oriental language, not very easy. My best advice to give you is try working with the language you choose head on, study the text and format of which it’s written in. Try taking a statement within the language and try spacing it out and learning which each part means in the language, and remember that the format of every programming language is built in a fashion where each part is dependent on a previous or containing part in the language text. For a first language, i’d have to say Python would be the easiest and such, you shouldn’t just jump into C or something. After learning Python if you’re still interested in learning more languages go ahead and try out Java, it’s fairly easier to comprehend and learn once you’ve studied Python for awhile.

Hope this helped ^^.

Read full topic

item.title: Which language should I learn?
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

Personally, I prefer English, It is compatible with most countries. But if you wish, Spanish is around 2nd or 3rd most compatible. Japanese might be fun to learn tho.

Oh Programming language? I prefer Java XD. But it more depends on what you are learning it for, I think for RSPS its easier for java, kinda my personal opinion. But in today’s world, C# is becoming more popular, Idk why. It is very similar to Java, however, as of the moment, I am failing at it XD however I have coded SOME C#. – So I suggest Java.

Call of duty > RuneScape
World of warcraft > Runescape
Halo > RuneScape
[/quote]

Call of Duty is a console game.
Halo is a console game.

You do realize that on consoles, the only language developers can use is C. I also hope you realize that consoles games are very different than computer games, and that this person won’t want to develop console games (as this would be his first programming language, and he has no experience with game development.

@World of Warcraft: it has less members than Minecraft’s and Runescape’s.[/quote]Why do you think consoles use C++? because it has a lot more potential then java.
and i’m talking about ACTIVE USERS, NOT ACCOUNTS MADE. All of Blizzards games are ran in C++ from knowledge, and they run a lot more smoothly then runegays.

**Oh and are you aware runescape uses a different scripting language then java? Because it limited them.

item.title: Which language should I learn?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

In order to make an informed decision on what programming language to start with, you should always consider what your final objectives are: why are you taking up programming in the first place? Do you think it will be a predominant part of your working life, or do you just want to enhance your problem solving skills?

In case you chose the latter, such high-level interpreted programming languages as Lisp or Python should be your choice; but if you are passionate about programming per se and your goal is trying to understand the low-level mechanisms that make your PC work, the C programming language is the right option for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Which language should I learn?
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:5, topic:376294"][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=472093.msg3455201#msg3455201 date=1293998610]

Why liquid?
[/quote]because java hides a ton of shit from their programmers.

LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOL
not only is there a complete documentation on java, but it is open source

You’re an idiot. ‘Java hides a lot of things from you’ means that it won’t give you the low-level raw power that you get when you use C++.

Nice Google search. Also, Java will get you farther since it is the most common for game development. C++ has been used for security programs over game development.

You’re also an idiot. Name a few popular games written in Java(other than Runescape). Almost all commercial desktop applications are written in C++(this includes games). And what exactly is a ‘security program’?

1.) I hope you’re trolling, I can’t think of a situation where you would need “access to low-level raw power”.

2.) Java is used in Android applications, games including (but not limited to) MineCraft, RuneScape, and almost everything on Playray.com (minigolf).

MineCraft statistics:

3453 players online, in 1115 servers.
2875678 registered users, of which 931306 (32.38%) have bought the game.

In the last 24 hours, 28318 people registered, and 7187 people bought the game.

I also bet you also know how popular RuneScape and Android are.

I also hope you know how popular World of Warcraft is, Aion, Mozilla Firefox, and Google Chrome is.

That’s not even 1/4th of a small list.

HEY BROSKI: WE ARE TALKING ABOUT GAME DEVELOPMENT, ONLY ONE OF THOSE IS A WELL KNOWN GAME (what is aion)[/quote]
Got carried away there. There are just so many… And Aion is an MMORPG, with really good graphics.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:2, topic:376294"][quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=472093.msg3452421#msg3452421 date=1293845097]

[/quote]

half of you is concentrated idiot, and the other half is horse-shit.

@topic

Java is probably the easiest to learn (besides C# or VB…).
If not Java:
Ruby is cool (but looks very very ugly)
Or python
Or C
Or Pearl
Or C++ [bad] [C is better]

EDIT:

[quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=472093.msg3452489#msg3452489 date=1293848668]

Why liquid?
[/quote]because java hides a ton of shit from their programmers. and limits them in a lot of ways. I only mean that for game devving. c/c++ supports a TON of GAPI’s and is a very powerful low-level language. the syntax may confuse you at first, but start to you will eventually start understanding it, and learning what you can and can’t do.

LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOL
not only is there a complete documentation on java, but it is open source[/quote]

You’re an idiot. ‘Java hides a lot of things from you’ means that it won’t give you the low-level raw power that you get when you use C++.

What is C++ used for? It is the industry standard game development language, and a powerful one for making programs too. And you haven’t given me one good reason why Java “will get you into a lot of things”.

Nice Google search. Also, Java will get you farther since it is the most common for game development. C++ has been used for security programs over game development.[/quote]

You’re also an idiot. Name a few popular games written in Java(other than Runescape). Almost all commercial desktop applications are written in C++(this includes games). And what exactly is a ‘security program’?

If you want to learn C++, it’s good if you’re already knowledgeable enough with Java. Likewise if you want to learn Java. Their syntaxes are similar, because Java is derived from it. The only thing that’s been confusing to me in C++ is using pointers/references.[/quote]I actually tampered with C++ long before i even opened up my first java file.
